children.subject: I wouldn’t recommend taking 189 and 184 in the spring together as both have a heavy workload, unless that’s like all you’re planning on taking. I took 184 this semester with like 5 lighter classes (which probably amounted to a workload of 184+189+another tech) and I pretty much had no free time.

history.content:
Assuming you've taken 61c, it's better to take 162 soon afterward since you'll have the concepts fresh in your memory.  Also, the sooner you take 162, the sooner you can apply your knowledge towards interviews.

I haven't taken 184 or 189, but I would recommend looking at this link, specifically under the workload section:

https://eecs.berkeley.edu/resources/undergrads/cs/degree-reqs-upperdiv

It's not recommended to take 'heavy' classes like 184 and 189 together.  I took 162 and 164 this semester, and really regret doing it, as I had no time to properly study for either class.  Perhaps it's doable if you already have a background in either graphics or machine learning beforehand.

I am a rising senior, and I was wondering when to take 162, since I have heard it's really helpful for interviews and things you need to know. My tentative schedule would be:

162+194-26 in Fall

184+ 189 in Spring

Is this a doable schedule? Will I die in the spring?
history.subject: When to take 162?
